channel.title: Trying to edit my shell32.dll file
channel.description:
I need a bitmap in the shell32 redone and I was hoping maybe some graphics master could do it for me please.
Heres the link for what i want it to look like
[IMG]http://i167.photobucket.com/albums/u125/deoxys505/Buttons.jpg[/img]
And here is what i need edited please
[IMG]http://i167.photobucket.com/albums/u125/deoxys505/Buttons32.jpg[/img]
Whoever takes this, I really appreciate it.
P.S. i'll attach the files so you can edit them without having to download from phhotobucket. BTW the second upload image, even tho it looks distorted, is fine.

[/quote]thanks, but i just got done w/ it.

here it is:

thanks for all the help. i really appreciate you guys trying!!

item.source: Trying to edit my shell32.dll file

item.title: Trying to edit my shell32.dll file
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

To clarify for those who don’t understand:

At the top, the shutdown key looks glassy. It is comprised of two main gradients.

At the bottom, the logoff button looks matte. It is just lighting on a smooth piece of plastic.

He wants the logoff and switch user buttons to look glassy like the shutdown key, not matte/plastic like it is now.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to edit my shell32.dll file
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

glass look + key = key with glass background.

basically, i need the glass background with the key.

item.source: Trying to edit my shell32.dll file

item.title: Trying to edit my shell32.dll file
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

exe626:

I honestly can’t figure out what he wants done. He provides these buttons and says “they should look like these” - why don’t you use those?

because one is for the log off screen and the other is for the shutdown screen. if i put the log off ones for the shutdown screen and vice versa, then it would mess up the dll and crash my computer.

I want the color scheme to match that of the top set of buttons. kind of like a glass look. not the luna look. I want both images the same with the exception of the icon parts (instead of a luna looking key, i want a glass looking key.) is that more confusing? or does that help?

Read full topic
